question.body: Blood is considered to be a connective tissue because it contains __________.

multiple_choice.choice: multiple cells types with significant extracellular matrix.
hemoglobin to assist in transporting oxygen.
a large amount of extracellular matrix and no cells.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Neurons are part of nervous tissue.
Correct. Connective tissue is characterized by containing multiple cell types and a large amount of extracellular matrix.
Incorrect. Although it has hemoglobin, this does not make it a connective tissue.
Incorrect. Although having a large amount of extracellular matrix is a characteristic of connective tissue, there must also be cells.
